definition:
A [*Pierpont prime*]{} is a prime number of the form $p = 1 + 2^x3^y$
with $-1 < y \le x$. If $x > 0$ and $y = 0$ then the resulting prime is
a Fermat prime. In the , the Pierpont primes are class 1-. The first few
Pierpont primes are 2, 3, 5, 7, 13, 17, 19, 37, 73, 97, 109, 163, 193,
257, 433, 487, 577, 769, etc., listed in A005109 of Sloane’s OEIS.

In 1988, Gleason showed that an $n$-sided regular polygon can be
constructed with ruler and compass if $n$ is the product of two Pierpont
primes.
